title: PM Modi, On Historic Visit To Brunei, Goes To Iconic Mosque, Meets Families
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today visited the renowned Omar Ali Saifuddien Mosque in Brunei, during his two-day visit to the nation. His visit to Brunei is aimed at bolstering bilateral ties between the two countries.
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today visited the renowned Omar Ali Saifuddien Mosque in Brunei, during his two-day visit to the nation. His visit to Brunei is aimed at bolstering bilateral ties between the two countries.

title: Mobile Phones And Brain Cancer Are Not Linked, Says WHO-Led Study
content: There is no link between mobile phone use and increased brain cancer risk, according to a new World Health Organization-commissioned review of the available published evidence worldwide.
summary: There is no link between mobile phone use and increased brain cancer risk, according to a new World Health Organization-commissioned review of the available published evidence worldwide.

title: Listeria Outbreak Kills 9 In US, Experts Advise Checking Refrigerated Food
content: Deadly Listeria outbreak linked to deli meats, first reported in July, has resulted in at least 57 hospitalizations and nine deaths across 18 US states, according to the CDC.
summary: Deadly Listeria outbreak linked to deli meats, first reported in July, has resulted in at least 57 hospitalizations and nine deaths across 18 US states, according to the CDC.

title: Watch: PM Modi Interacts With Indians In Brunei During Bilateral Visit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received a warm welcome by the members of the Indian community in Brunei Darussalam today.
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received a warm welcome by the members of the Indian community in Brunei Darussalam today.

title: Larry, The 10 Downing Street Cat In UK, Gets A 'Russian' Rival 'JoJo'
content: Larry the Downing Street cat is facing a challenge to his position as the British government's chief mouser -- a cute "Russian" kitten.
summary: Larry the Downing Street cat is facing a challenge to his position as the British government's chief mouser -- a cute "Russian" kitten.

title: "Shameful" Of UK To Halt Some Arms Export Licenses To Israel: Netanyahu
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Tuesday that the British government made a "shameful decision" when it suspended some arms export licences to Israel.
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Tuesday that the British government made a "shameful decision" when it suspended some arms export licences to Israel.

title: UK Woman And Partner Jailed After Planning To Drug, Rape Her Daughter
content: The woman, from East Cornwall, received a 17-year prison sentence, while the man, from North Cornwall, was sentenced to 13 years.
summary: The woman, from East Cornwall, received a 17-year prison sentence, while the man, from North Cornwall, was sentenced to 13 years.

title: 49 Killed In Ukraine's Poltava After Russia Launches 2 Ballistic Missiles
content: At least 49 people have been killed and more than 219 injured in Ukraine's Poltava after two Russian ballistic missiles hit a military education facility today.
summary: At least 49 people have been killed and more than 219 injured in Ukraine's Poltava after two Russian ballistic missiles hit a military education facility today.

title: Earthquakes Play A Vital Role In The Formation Of Gold Nuggets: Study
content: A recent study suggests that earthquakes may significantly contribute to the formation of gold nuggets within quartz veins through a process known as piezoelectricity.
summary: A recent study suggests that earthquakes may significantly contribute to the formation of gold nuggets within quartz veins through a process known as piezoelectricity.

title: PM Modi Arrives In Brunei On Historic 2-Day Visit. Here's What Is Planned
content: PM Modi arrived at the Bandar Seri Begawan Airport this afternoon as he began a two-day visit to Brunei Darussalam - the first ever bilateral trip by an Indian PM to the southeast Asian nation - at the invitation of Sultan Haji Hassanal Bolkiah.
summary: PM Modi arrived at the Bandar Seri Begawan Airport this afternoon as he began a two-day visit to Brunei Darussalam - the first ever bilateral trip by an Indian PM to the southeast Asian nation - at the invitation of Sultan Haji Hassanal Bolkiah.

title: Australia Makes 1st Aircraft Deployment In India For 'Tarang Shakti'- II
content: The Royal Australian Air Force has made its first deployment of combat aircraft in India for participation in exercise 'Tarang Shakti', Australia's Defence department said in a statement.
summary: The Royal Australian Air Force has made its first deployment of combat aircraft in India for participation in exercise 'Tarang Shakti', Australia's Defence department said in a statement.

title: Geologists Say Quartz And Few Earthquakes Can Make A Giant Gold Nugget
content: Humanitys fascination with gold stretches back thousands of years. Gold mining is described in ancient Greek and Roman sources, and gold rushes  especially in the 19th century played a powerful role in shaping the modern world.
summary: Humanitys fascination with gold stretches back thousands of years. Gold mining is described in ancient Greek and Roman sources, and gold rushes  especially in the 19th century played a powerful role in shaping the modern world.

title: Indian Gets 14-Year Jail Term In Singapore For Sexually Harassing Girl
content: A 52-year-old Indian national has been sentenced to 14 months of jail for molesting a teenage girl from a known family.
summary: A 52-year-old Indian national has been sentenced to 14 months of jail for molesting a teenage girl from a known family.

title: Sunken Village Emerges Amidst Greece's Record Drought
content: Record-breaking temperatures and prolonged drought in Greece have exposed a sunken village in Athens' main reservoir for the first time in 30 years.
summary: Record-breaking temperatures and prolonged drought in Greece have exposed a sunken village in Athens' main reservoir for the first time in 30 years.

title: All You Need To Know About Brunei's Sultan Hassanal Bolkiah, His Family
content: Sultan Hassanal Bolkiah's primary home, the Istana Nurul Iman Palace, is the world's largest residential palace.

title: Frozen Body Found In Pennsylvania Cave Finally Identified After 50 Years
content: A cold case that baffled authorities and intrigued locals for nearly half a century has finally come to a close.
summary: A cold case that baffled authorities and intrigued locals for nearly half a century has finally come to a close.

title: "I Ask For Forgiveness...": Benjamin Netanyahu On Death Of Israeli Hostages
content: Prime Minister of Israel Benjamin Netanyahu on Monday sought forgiveness for not being able to save the lives of six Iseraeli hostages, whose bodies were found in a tunnel in Gaza.
summary: Prime Minister of Israel Benjamin Netanyahu on Monday sought forgiveness for not being able to save the lives of six Iseraeli hostages, whose bodies were found in a tunnel in Gaza.

title: 129 Killed In Attempted Prison Break In Congo
content: At least 129 people were killed during a weekend prison break attempt at the largest jail in the Democratic Republic of Congo, the interior minister said on Tuesday.
summary: At least 129 people were killed during a weekend prison break attempt at the largest jail in the Democratic Republic of Congo, the interior minister said on Tuesday.

title: Elon Musk "Can't Wait" To Be Part Of Donald Trump's Cabinet
content: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has confirmed he wants to work with former President Donald Trump in auditing US agencies to identify programmes for cuts.
summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has confirmed he wants to work with former President Donald Trump in auditing US agencies to identify programmes for cuts.

title: Brazil Top Court Reinstates Jail Terms For 2013 Fire That Killed 242
content: A Brazilian supreme court judge ordered Monday the immediate imprisonment of four people convicted for their role in a nightclub fire that killed 242 people more than a decade ago.
summary: A Brazilian supreme court judge ordered Monday the immediate imprisonment of four people convicted for their role in a nightclub fire that killed 242 people more than a decade ago.
